intro: Limnophila cana, commonly known as water thyme, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Pontederiaceae. It is characterized by its submerged or floating leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. Limnophila cana is often found in nutrient-rich waters and can form dense mats on the water surface. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
